data.title: Good, but there are better places without a line.
data.text: Most homemade ice cream is delicious, kind of goes without saying, I just have had better ice cream in other places in Indianapolis without a line.

data.title: So delicious
data.text: I've had some excellent and 'renowned' ice cream in my time, but Handels is actually the best. So many different options and flavors and I have yet to be disappointed!

data.title: Maybe nothing better in summer, but it's open year-round!
data.text:
Cold, generous, tasty servings of Rick, creamy ice cream, coupled with friendly lines of fellow ice cream lovers. Sitting on the side street  at the tables, or maybe on the low brick wall out front, or walking a block/over the RR tracks, to the Fishers municipal area, while enjoying your special favorite flavored treat. 

Handel's, sitting in that little strip mall, is as Fishers as it gets. My fave flavor is chocoholic chunk, but everyone smiles with their own #1 treat in mind as they wait patiently in line to make their order, and then walks away with the first taste on their lips, uttering words like "wow" or "oh man; that's perfect"!  

It sure is!  It's Handels on 116th, just east of the tracks in downtown Fishers.  See you there, any month of the year!

data.title: Management Problem
data.text:
Yes, the ice cream was good.

BUT......70 degree Saturday evening and there are only three employees, all teenagers who moved at one speed (which was not fast).  No sign of an adult manager or owner.  Given the prices charged, more employees would be reasonable.  AND, if the wait were not so long, sales probably would have been higher......how many people drove by without stopping when they saw such a long line????

 Waiting an hour for ice cream to satisfy my wife is the epitome of love !!!

Thus the rating which is lower than it probably should be.

owner_response.author: gregglaros, Owner at Handel's Homemade Ice Cream, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Unhappy Customer,

Thank you for your feedback.   We are VERY tuned into the weather and always want to make certain we have sufficient staffing, particularly on warm weekend nights.   We actually had FOUR people working Saturday night, but one of our employees went home sick and we were unable to obtain additional help on such short notice.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Simply the best
data.text: Great quality ice cream. Huge portions. Mint chocolate chip is the best. Family arrive back home to Fishers always hits Handels first.

data.title: Handel's a nice place.
data.text: The system is some what slow, typical ice cream shop with custom orders.  Staff has always been friendly and the ice cream is very high quality.  It was a nice warm fall day and the lines were not to long.

data.title: Homemade
data.text: My family & I just stopped after dinner tonight. The line was long but that's a good sign .. I Lo ved there dark chocolate ice cream ....

owner_response.author: gregglaros, Owner at Handel's Homemade Ice Cream, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate your feedback.   What could we have done to improve your experience?
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great after-dinner stop!
data.text: Quite the throwback ice cream stop in our little town. Mom and one of our boys love it. They are skinny and can use the tasty calories. Nice side patio to watch them enjoy too.

data.title: Excellent Ice Cream & Excellent Service
data.text: My family & I just stopped after dinner tonight.  The line was long but we know that about Handles.  The ice cream is awesome but it's also about the social experience with other customers and the staff.   Tonight Brooke was our server and her pleasant demeanor made a great experience even better.  Thanks, Brooke! She was cheerful and fun.  The 5 of us had a great great time there.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: I went there for the very first time just a few weeks ago.  Having lived in Fishers for 7 years now, I do not know what took me so long!  It is a wonderful treat for a hot summer day...fall and spring too!  Haven't tried a flavor I don't like!

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: Every time I visit Fishers, I have to treat myself to an awesome sundae from Handel's! There is almost always a line but it is well worth the wait. Even in the winter at certain times of the day there is a line.

data.title: Ice cream
data.text: Long line./ Slow service.   Handel's has only 2 people at their window for orders.  The ice cream is very good but very expensive.  I miss Bluebell.

data.title: Classic dessert stop!
data.text: Quite the walk-up throwback kind of place with very tasty treats.  Our family loves it.  I'm too old for such levels of sugar...but the rest of our family makes up for me.  This is a summer beach treat kinda place right in the middle of our little town.  Very sweet.

data.title: So Worth the Wait!
data.text:
The ice cream was so amazing that we went 2 nights in a row and tried to find something better the 3rd night.  NO WAY,  This is the best.  Wish we had one here in Ventura County! But I see they have shops in Redondo Beach, Upland and Encinitas!
The  first night I got a vanilla with pecans. There were full on pecans pieces in each bite. Yum.

data.title: Best ice cream on the planet!!
data.text: Best ice cream on the planet!! Dozens of rich real and natural flavors!! Nice easy walk in middle of the safest cleanest nicest city in America

data.title: Best ice cream ever!
data.text: My husband, a major ice cream connoisseur, and I discovered this ice cream shop when passing through Indianapolis (Fishers) on the way to Michigan to drop our daughter off at college three years ago. Ever since then, EVERY time we go through Fishers, we stop to enjoy the best ice cream ever! Handel's has so many wonderful favors, homemade on site, that it is hard to decide what flavor to get. Recently, we were happy to discover the 4-scoop sampler. I can't recommend Handel's enough - it is simply the best ice cream ever!

data.title: "Lots of Flavors to choose from."
data.text: We have passed Handel's Homemade Ice Cream hundreds of times, but did not have the opportunity to stop and order some delicious ice cream . . . until today.  Usually, the long lines of people waiting out front have discouraged us from stopping, but not this evening.  With gray skies and a rather wet and rainy afternoon, the lines had disappeared, so it was our turn to taste some hand-dipped ice cream.  I selected the Chunky Chocolate Chip in a cup and it was really good.  My wife likes anything with coconut in it, so she selected Coconut Creme Pie ice cream and it was really good.  If you like to stand in rather long lines before placing your ice cream treat order, then this is the place for you . . . but the wait can be well worth the delay.

data.title: Fun flavors with unique menu
data.text: Great for those trying to buy local-not a chain etc. Excellent variety-almost so many it can be overwhelming! Children love to try their interesting flavors that you don't typically find. Only complaint is if you time it wrong-you can wait in a disorganized line for awhile. Some items take longer to make and without clear lines, it can get frustrating if behind a long line. That being said it is typically worth the wait!

data.title: Best Ice Cream!
data.text:
Every time we are in Carmel, IN we must go to Handel's!!
Unfortunately, we do not have this establishment in southern Indiana but really enjoy it while in northern Indiana.

data.title: It doesn't get any better.
data.text: A few years ago, this was listed as a top ten ice cream place in America. Nothing has changed. For the best deal, get a four scoop sampler.
